refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: D-Bus utility functions used in telepathy-glib.

refsect2.title: tp_dbus_g_method_return_not_implemented ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_dbus_g_method_return_not_implemented (DBusGMethodInvocation *context);
refsect2.para: Return the Telepathy error NotImplemented from the method invocation given by context.

listitem.simpara: The D-Bus method invocation context

refsect2.title: tp_get_bus ()
refsect2.programlisting: DBusGConnection* tp_get_bus (void);

listitem.simpara: a connection to the starter or session D-Bus daemon.

refsect2.title: tp_get_bus_proxy ()
refsect2.programlisting: DBusGProxy* tp_get_bus_proxy (void);

listitem.simpara: a proxy for the bus daemon object on the starter or session bus.

refsect2.title: enum TpDBusNameType
refsect2.para: A set of flags indicating which D-Bus bus names are acceptable. They can be combined with the bitwise-or operator to accept multiple types. TP_DBUS_NAME_TYPE_NOT_BUS_DAEMON and TP_DBUS_NAME_TYPE_ANY are the bitwise-or of other appropriate types, for convenience.

listitem.simpara: accept unique names like :1.123 (not including the name of the bus daemon itself)
accept well-known names like com.example.Service (not including the name of the bus daemon itself)
accept the name of the bus daemon itself, which has the syntax of a well-known name, but behaves like a unique name
accept either unique or well-known names, but not the bus daemon
accept any of the above

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_dbus_check_valid_bus_name ()
refsect2.para: Check that the given string is a valid D-Bus bus name of an appropriate type.

listitem.simpara: a possible bus name
some combination of TP_DBUS_NAME_TYPE_UNIQUE, TP_DBUS_NAME_TYPE_WELL_KNOWN or TP_DBUS_NAME_TYPE_BUS_DAEMON (often this will be TP_DBUS_NAME_TYPE_NOT_BUS_DAEMON or TP_DBUS_NAME_TYPE_ANY)
used to raise TP_DBUS_ERROR_INVALID_BUS_NAME if FALSE is returned
TRUE if name is valid

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_dbus_check_valid_interface_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_dbus_check_valid_interface_name (const gchar *name, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Check that the given string is a valid D-Bus interface name. This is also appropriate to use to check for valid error names.

listitem.simpara: a possible interface name
used to raise TP_DBUS_ERROR_INVALID_INTERFACE_NAME if FALSE is returned
TRUE if name is valid

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_dbus_check_valid_member_name ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_dbus_check_valid_member_name (const gchar *name, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Check that the given string is a valid D-Bus member (method or signal) name.

listitem.simpara: a possible member name
used to raise TP_DBUS_ERROR_INVALID_MEMBER_NAME if FALSE is returned
TRUE if name is valid

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_dbus_check_valid_object_path ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_dbus_check_valid_object_path (const gchar *path, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Check that the given string is a valid D-Bus object path.

listitem.simpara: a possible object path
used to raise TP_DBUS_ERROR_INVALID_OBJECT_PATH if FALSE is returned
TRUE if path is valid

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_boolean ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and boolean, return it, and set *valid to TRUE if valid is not NULL.
Otherwise return FALSE, and set *valid to FALSE if valid is not NULL.
(FIXME: should we also allow 'i' and 'u' with nonzero <=> True?)

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
Either NULL, or a location to store TRUE if the key actually exists and has a boolean value
a boolean value for key since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_boxed ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is of the desired type, return it.
Otherwise return NULL.
The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it, for instance with g_boxed_copy(), if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
The type that the key's value should have, which must be derived from G_TYPE_BOXED
the value of key, or NULL since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_bytes ()
refsect2.programlisting: const GArray* tp_asv_get_bytes (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is an array of bytes (its GType is DBUS_TYPE_G_UCHAR_ARRAY), return it.
Otherwise return NULL.

The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it with g_boxed_copy (DBUS_TYPE_G_UCHAR_ARRAY, ...) if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
the string value of key, or NULL since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_double ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and has any numeric type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64, guint64 or gdouble), return it as a double, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0.0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the double precision floating-point value of key, or 0.0 since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_int32 ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, has an integer type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64 or guint64) and fits in the range of a gint32, return it, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the 32-bit signed integer value of key, or 0 since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_int64 ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, has an integer type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64 or guint64) and fits in the range of a gint64, return it, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the 64-bit signed integer value of key, or 0 since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_object_path ()
refsect2.programlisting: const gchar* tp_asv_get_object_path (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is an object path, return it.
Otherwise return NULL.
The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it with g_strdup() if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
the object-path value of key, or NULL since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: const gchar* tp_asv_get_string (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is a string, return it.
Otherwise return NULL.
The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it with g_strdup() if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
the string value of key, or NULL since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_strv ()
refsect2.programlisting: const gchar* const * tp_asv_get_strv (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present and is an array of strings (strv), return it.
Otherwise return NULL.
The returned value is not copied, and is only valid as long as the value for key in asv is not removed or altered. Copy it with g_strdupv() if you need to keep it for longer.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
the NULL-terminated string-array value of key, or NULL since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_uint32 ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, has an integer type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64 or guint64) and fits in the range of a guint32, return it, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the 32-bit unsigned integer value of key, or 0 since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_get_uint64 ()
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, has an integer type used by dbus-glib (guchar, gint, guint, gint64 or guint64) and is non-negative, return it, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to TRUE.
Otherwise, return 0, and if valid is not NULL, set *valid to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
Either NULL, or a location in which to store TRUE on success or FALSE on failure
the 64-bit unsigned integer value of key, or 0 since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: tp_asv_lookup ()
refsect2.programlisting: const GValue* tp_asv_lookup (const GHashTable *asv, const gchar *key);
refsect2.para: If a value for key in asv is present, return it. Otherwise return NULL.

listitem.simpara: A GHashTable where the keys are strings and the values are GValues
The key to look up
the value of key, or NULL since 0.7.9

refsect2.title: TpDBusDaemon
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct _TpDBusDaemon TpDBusDaemon;
refsect2.para: A subclass of TpProxy that represents the D-Bus daemon. It mainly provides functionality to manage well-known names on the bus.
Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: TpDBusDaemonClass
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct _TpDBusDaemonClass TpDBusDaemonClass;
refsect2.para: The class of TpDBusDaemon.
Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_dbus_daemon_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpDBusDaemon* tp_dbus_daemon_new (DBusGConnection *connection);

listitem.simpara: a connection to D-Bus
a new proxy for signals and method calls on the bus daemon to which connection is connected

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: TpDBusDaemonNameOwnerChangedCb ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*TpDBusDaemonNameOwnerChangedCb) (TpDBusDaemon *daemon, const gchar *name, const gchar *new_owner, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: The signature of the callback called by tp_dbus_daemon_watch_name_owner().

listitem.simpara: The D-Bus daemon
The name whose ownership has changed or been discovered
The unique name that now owns name
Arbitrary user-supplied data as passed to tp_dbus_daemon_watch_name_owner()

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_dbus_daemon_watch_name_owner ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_dbus_daemon_watch_name_owner (TpDBusDaemon *self, const gchar *name, TpDBusDaemonNameOwnerChangedCb callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Arrange for callback to be called with the owner of name as soon as possible (which might even be before this function returns!), then again every time the ownership of name changes.
If multiple watches are registered for the same name, they will be called in the order they were registered.

listitem.simpara: The D-Bus daemon
The name whose ownership is to be watched
Callback to call when the ownership is discovered or changes
Arbitrary data to pass to callback
Called to destroy user_data when the name owner watch is cancelled due to tp_dbus_daemon_cancel_name_owner_watch()

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_dbus_daemon_cancel_name_owner_watch ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_dbus_daemon_cancel_name_owner_watch (TpDBusDaemon *self, const gchar *name, TpDBusDaemonNameOwnerChangedCb callback, gconstpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: If there was a previous call to tp_dbus_daemon_watch_name_owner() with exactly the given name, callback and user_data, remove it.
If more than one watch matching the details provided was active, remove only the most recently added one.

listitem.simpara: the D-Bus daemon
the name that was being watched
the callback that was called
the user data that was provided
TRUE if there was such a watch, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_cli_dbus_daemon_call_add_match ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall* tp_cli_dbus_daemon_call_add_match (TpDBusDaemon *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const gchar *in0, tp_cli_dbus_daemon_callback_for_add_match callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a AddMatch method call.
(Undocumented)

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal NameAcquired.
(Undocumented)

listitem.simpara: A TpDBusDaemon or subclass
Callback to be called when the signal is received
User-supplied data for the callback
Destructor for the user-supplied data, which will be called when this signal is disconnected, or before this function returns NULL
If not NULL, used to raise an error if NULL is returned
a TpProxySignalConnection containing all of the above, which can be used to disconnect the signal; or NULL if the proxy does not have the desired interface or has become invalid.
